display_long_description:
· Getting a picture of the situation
> Learn how to quickly assess your surroundings and the patient's condition in the event of an emergency. This helps you prioritize first aid and respond effectively.

· Dealing with foreign substances
> If foreign substances enter your eyes, experience how to remove them by washing them with running physiological saline. Through this, learn how to prevent additional damage caused by foreign substances.

· First aid in case of tooth damage
> If a tooth is broken or missing, learn how to stop the damaged area and preserve the missing tooth by immersing it in saline or milk. Through this, learn the correct first aid in case of tooth damage.

· First aid for trauma and burns
> Experience how to prevent contamination by letting clean water flow through the wound and covering the wound with a dry cloth or gauze for hemostasis. In case of burns, cool the wound with cold water and, in severe case, cover it with a gauze or cloth soaked in cold water.

· To deal with head damage
> Learn how to assess the patient's condition in the event of a head injury and call for emergency medical care, if necessary; learn how to respond appropriately in the event of a head injury.

· Using splints, triangles, and bandages
>Experience how to use splints and triangular guns to fix suspected fractures. This will help stabilize the injured area and prevent further damage.
